citations.narrative:
There were 13 whelping pens that had excessively worn carpets. The carpets were seen to have excessively frayed
edges (2-3 inches in length) with longs strands (4-6 inches) of carpet fibers hanging off. In some cases, the puppies have
ripped off these long strands and created small balls of tangled carpet fibers. Frayed edges and long strands of carpet
fibers can be problematic because they may cause illness or injury if a puppy ingests the pieces of carpet or if they wrap
around their appendages. Correct by ensuring all surfaces in the enclosures are maintained on a regular basis and that
surfaces which cannot be readily cleaned are replaced when worn. Correct by: September 17, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There were 13 whelping pens that had excessively worn carpets. The carpets were seen to have excessively frayed 
edges (2-3 inches in length) with longs strands (4-6 inches) of carpet fibers hanging off. In some cases, the puppies have 
ripped off these long strands and created small balls of tangled carpet fibers. Frayed edges and long strands of carpet 
fibers can be problematic because they may cause illness or injury if a puppy ingests the pieces of carpet or if they wrap 
around their appendages. Correct by ensuring all surfaces in the enclosures are maintained on a regular basis and that 
surfaces which cannot be readily cleaned are replaced when worn. Correct by: September 17, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
